sourcesContent:
// Environment // Components const BackgroundExperience = () => { return (

Background Experience
Soft Skills

Programming World

In the attempt of not being a poor starving artist I decided to pivot into a different career. Like the nerd that I am. I’ve always been interested in programming. Seeing how much these kids are being compared to all the other kids. It was an obvious decision for me. Jumped into the Computer Science rabbit hole. Landed in Frontend Development, eventually will run back into the Creative industry.

3D Artist

Living my dream of being a movie director. Being able to do everything from conceptualizing ideas to bringing them to life. Being able to do all the roles all at once, make all the decisions by myself, wearing the hats of: the Director, Producer, Art Director, Director of Photography, etc, etc… etc. Being able to immerse myself in myself, discovering who I am and what I want to become. Understanding the struggles of the artist and fully becoming one. While trying to produce work and developing skill sets to be able to afford food. It was a beautiful journey. But I have now found Bitcoin and I’m now in the money game.

2D Motion Designer

Picking up 2D Motion Design while I was at my first job. Watching tutorials as soon as I get home tired and all. I still kept watching tutorials and learning about the 2D animation world and After Effects. I knew this was important so I kept pursuing this no matter how tired I was after work. This was the only thing I was interested in back then.

Film Production Background

I got an Advertising Degree so I could pursue a solid safe Movie Director Career, after being convinced by a Movie Director who did the same. So I did. Intern in a couple of movie sets that changed my life. The act of recording a movie is a movie by itself. Got to see and worked with the best talent in the country. How they think, move and talk. It was a blessing and an experience that I will never forget.

Advertising Hell Hole

A quote from a book I read back in college.
“The advertising world is where the Artist goes to die.”
I never wanted to work in an Ad agency, but the Idea of being a Creative Director really caught my attention. I didn't know that being a Creative was a job and a career. So I delved deep into it and wanted to find out everything I could about it. Interned in one of the top Ad agencies as a Creative Junior got to experience the life cycle and the process of creativity and campaigns from the perspective of the Creative Director and the whole crew. Art Director and Copywriter.
It was fun.

Entrepreneurship, Business and Freelance.

While having to work on myself, my skills and my art.
I had to learn about business, clients, and what it means to be an entrepreneur running your own business. Having to market yourself, talk to clients, negotiate and keep strong for all those 7 years. All while doing it yourself with no one else helping you except the mentors I chose on the internet. I will forever be grateful and hope to someday meet my heroes and give them a hug. For telling me that I can do this, all I need to do is to stay strong and believe in myself!

); } export default BackgroundExperience;
